explanation: A topic or issue that is widely disputed and discussed.
example: Climate change has become a hot potato in recent years.

explanation: A way of asking what someone is thinking.
example: You've been quiet all evening. A penny for your thoughts?

explanation: Legitimate, honest, and open.
example: All the dealings of the company are above board.

explanation: Someone who often forgets things or does not pay attention to what's happening around them.
example: Kathe is so absent-minded. She always forgets her appointments and even her own birthday.

explanation: An action that is said to be accidental, but was actually intentional.
example: I think she lost my number accidentally on purpose.

explanation: To explain or justify something.
example: He couldn't account for his absence from the meeting.

explanation: A person's main weakness.
example: His inability to delegate was his Achilles' heel.

explanation: A test that definitively proves whether something is true or false.
example: The acid test for the product will be whether people actually buy it.

explanation: Including everyone or everything.
example: The company has implemented cost-cutting measures across the board.

explanation: An event that is caused by nature and cannot be prevented by humans.
example: The insurance does not cover damage caused by acts of God such as floods or earthquakes.

explanation: To make a problem or conflict worse.
example: By arguing back, he was just adding fuel to the fire.

explanation: To do something as fast as possible and try to finish it before a certain time.
example: We were working against the clock to finish the project on time.

explanation: Listening carefully and with full attention.
example: I'm all ears, tell me about your day.

explanation: Clumsy or awkward.
example: I'm all thumbs today, I've already broken two glasses.

explanation: Someone who is very precious or dear to someone.
example: Her grandson is the apple of her eye.

word: At the drop of a hat
explanation: Without any hesitation; instantly.
example: I'd quit my job at the drop of a hat if I didn't have a family to support.

word: At the end of one's tether
explanation: Having no patience, endurance, or resources left.
example: After two hours of hearing the children argue, their mother was at the end of her tether.

explanation: Having a selfish motive in the background.
example: He has an axe to grind with the boss, that's why he's working overtime.

explanation: Discussing or arguing about personal problems in public.
example: I wish you wouldn't air our dirty laundry in public like that.

explanation: Someone who talks tough but really isn't.
example: Don't worry about his threats, he's all bark and no bite.

explanation: Something that is not unusual; part of the normal routine.
example: Saving lives is all in a day's work for a firefighter.

explanation: Not focused or organized; covering a wide range of different things.
example: His study notes were all over the map and hard to follow.

word: All that glitters is not gold
explanation: Things that look valuable or true might not actually be so.
example: She thought the glamorous life of an actress would be amazing, but she soon realized that all that glitters is not gold.

explanation: A large amount of money.
example: This dress is nice, but it costs an arm and a leg.

explanation: Someone with whom one had a romantic relationship in the past.
example: I ran into an old flame at the grocery store today.

explanation: An object or topic that causes anger, arguments, or disagreement.
example: The property was the apple of discord between the two brothers.

explanation: At a point where a crucial decision must be made.
example: After college, I was at a crossroadsâ€”I had to decide which career path to take.

explanation: So worried, confused, or annoyed that you do not know what to do next.
example: I'm at my wit's end with this problem. I can't figure it out.

explanation: Very early in the morning, when the sun is just starting to rise.
example: She woke up at the crack of dawn to start her journey.

word: At the drop of a dime
explanation: Without any hesitation; instantly.
example: He was always ready to help his friends at the drop of a dime.

explanation: Something that is very easy to do.
example: The test was a piece of cake.

explanation: During the entire day.
example: I've been studying all day long.

explanation: Unexpectedly and quickly.
example: All of a sudden, it started raining.

explanation: As quickly as it can be done.
example: Please finish your homework as soon as possible.

explanation: Right now.
example: I'm busy at the moment.

explanation: A large number or amount of.
example: I have a lot of friends.

explanation: To a small degree.
example: I'm a little bit tired.

explanation: The time period following the end of school for the day.
example: I play football after school.

explanation: Continuously or constantly.
example: I think about you all the time.

explanation: In addition; and also.
example: I like playing football as well as basketball.
